result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E Kirkland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA WAIVED..
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with Waukesha Iron & Metal, Sjoberg Tool or Wisconsin Metal.

Case 14CF1277 was dismissed and read into: 14CF667.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Deceased

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1  2 and 3,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Withheld sentence STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 2 and 3
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived - not imposed.
- Restitution of $4800.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  No contact with Waukesha Iron and Metal, Sjoberg Tool or Wisconsin Metal. 

Ct. 2:
- Withheld sentence STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 1 and 3
- Fine totaling $578.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived - not imposed.
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  No contact with Waukesha Iron and Metal, Sjoberg Tool or Wisconsin Metal. 

Ct. 3:
- Withheld sentence STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 1 and 2
- Fine totaling $568.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived - not imposed.
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  No contact with Waukesha Iron and Metal, Sjoberg Tool or Wisconsin Metal.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing on 14CF1277. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed by the State. Reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED by Defense on 14CF1277.  Defense requests 14CF667 be set for jury status/trial and 14CF1277 trail along. Court grants request.  Bail stands as fixed. 
  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Mitchell requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that the State will amend if restitution is paid. Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with alleged business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Brian E Kirkland in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
